AbstractText.sentence: IL-12 is a 75-kDa heterodimeric cytokine composed of two covalently linked p35 and p40 chains.

AbstractText.sentence: In this study, we investigated the effects of a commonly prescribed anti-inflammatory drug, acetyl salicylic acid (ASA), on IL-12 production and Th1 cell development.

AbstractText.sentence: Analysis of the regulation of the p40 gene promoter revealed that ASA inhibited NF-kappaB activation and binding to the p40-kappaB site in the p40 promoter, leading to transcriptional repression of the p40 gene.

AbstractText.sentence: Addition of ASA to an in vitro T helper cell differentiation system, at concentrations compatible with plasma levels reached during anti-inflammatory therapy, resulted in reduced development of Th1 cells.
